head.title: Insurance Official Quits To Join Sports Agency

identified-content.org: New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority

hedline.hl1: Insurance Official Quits To Join Sports Agency

abstract.p: Elizabeth E Randall, Commissioner of New Jersey Department of Banking and Insurance, resigns, saying she intends to join New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority as vice president of project development and community relations; Gov Christine Todd Whitman says she intends to appoint Jaynee LaVecchia as Acting Commissioner (S)

block.p: Elizabeth E. Randall, Commissioner of the State Department of Banking and Insurance, resigned yesterday, saying she intended to join the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority as vice president of project development and community relations, the Governor's office announced.

Ms. Randall, who had held the position since 1996, is the fifth Cabinet member to resign since Governor Whitman was re-elected to a second term in November. During her tenure, the state's automobile insurance laws underwent major changes, including the ending of automatic annual premium increases and insurance surcharges.

Elizabeth E. Randall, Commissioner of the State Department of Banking and Insurance, resigned yesterday, saying she intended to join the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority as vice president of project development and community relations, the Governor's office announced.

Ms. Randall, who had held the position since 1996, is the fifth Cabinet member to resign since Governor Whitman was re-elected to a second term in November. During her tenure, the state's automobile insurance laws underwent major changes, including the ending of automatic annual premium increases and insurance surcharges.

Mrs. Whitman said she intended to appoint Jaynee LaVecchia, director of the State Division of Law, as Acting Commissioner. Ms. LaVecchia, of Bridgewater, would oversee the department's 609 employees and $39.5 million budget.
